column4: Well, again: Hello everybody. I have a problem. I am running on Lubuntu, and Ive downloaded a "Tibia" client from its main site, and when I try to run it, there appears and window where I have to choose an application to make it works. When I choose terminal, nothing happens.
from a quick look, it appears that Tibia is a windows program.  So i think the extension will be .exe
you have to choose between windows version and the linux one, ive choosen that compatible with linux
not really, go into "account" section and you will have there an option to download it without registering
ill be thankfull if Ill be able to play
I'm gonna try my best to help I'm not too used to how lubuntu works, I usually use ubuntu  It downloads as an archive file,  right click it and extract that in your download folder
so you were trying to run the StartTibia.sh file?
im now unable to do it (pc is under occupation) but ill try it when ill get it back to my hands
making it able to run as a program should make it so you can easily run it.
i was checking properties of this file and I do not remember if there was a function to check 'run as program' but i cant say if there wasnt
is there the same way to run it?
I just double clicked the Tibia file and it ran
when im doubleclicking it, then it gives me back a window to choose the best program to run it with
